11-355: Closing
   Article F. Penalties For Violation
11-360: Penalty
ARTICLE A. GENERAL PROVISIONS
11-301: DESIGNATION OF CITY OWNED LAKES AND RESERVOIRS:
The lake constructed by the city on Salt-Camp Creek is hereby designated and
named "Stroud Municipal Lake", and the police power of the city is hereby
extended to cover such lake. (2000 Code § 11-301)
11-302: THROWING UNSANITARY ITEMS IN LAKE PROHIBITED:
No person shall throw into or permit to enter Stroud Municipal Lake, or place,
throw or deposit upon the lands and premises surrounding such waters, any
unused bait, worms, flesh of animals or other matter subject to putrefaction,
or any human or animal excreta, or any other unsanitary or unsightly thing.
(2000 Code § 11-302)
11-303: WADING, SWIMMING IN LAKE:
   A.   Swimming in Stroud Municipal Lake will only be allowed by those areas
designated as swimming areas. Such areas will be marked by buoy line and
swimming will only be allowed on the beachside of the buoys. Swimming on the
lakeside of the buoys is prohibited.
   B.   Swimming from a boat or entering the water from a boat, except for the
purpose of skiing, sailing, windsurfing or scuba diving is prohibited.
   C.   Scuba diving is permitted in designated areas by written permission of
the city manager or his designee.
   D.   No person shall publicly appear nude or disrobe while in any area of
Stroud Lake.
   E.   All swimming shall be at the swimmer's own risk.
   F.   All children of the age of twelve (12) and younger must be accompanied
by an adult before entering the swimming area.
   G.   No animals will be allowed in the designated swimming area.
   H.   No glass containers are permitted in the swimming area or on the
designated beach area. (2000 Code § 11-303)
11-304: COLLECTION AND DISPOSAL OF GARBAGE AND REFUSE AROUND LAKE:
   A.   No person shall throw or place garbage upon the ground or the property
comprising the Stroud Municipal Lake, and all garbage or trash shall be placed
in containers and removed from the premises when the container becomes full.
   B.   The city or its agents and servants shall cause garbage cans to be
placed in all picnic grounds used by the public and all persons using such
picnic grounds shall place all garbage and refuse in such can, and the same
shall be removed and taken care of by the lake caretaker. (2000 Code § 11-304)
11-305: BURNING OF TRASH, BRUSH ON LAND AROUND LAKE:
   A.   No person shall burn any trash or refuse upon the property comprising
the watershed of Stroud Municipal Lake, and owned by the city, unless it is
burned in an incinerator or container to be approved by the lake caretaker.
   B.   No person shall burn grass, brush or other refuse upon the municipal
lake property belonging to the city, without first obtaining permission to do
so from the lake caretaker. No person shall burn grass or other rubbish around
any cabin site or upon any property under lease by the city to such person,
without first notifying the lake caretaker of his intention to do so, and
obtaining permission for the same from the caretaker. Any person desiring to
burn such grass or brush shall notify the caretaker of the same and it shall be
the duty of the caretaker to supervise such burning and no fire shall be
started except under the supervision of the lake caretaker. (2000 Code § 11-
305)
11-306: SEWAGE DISPOSAL FACILITIES ON PROPERTY AROUND LAKE:
   A.   All privies located on property owned by the city comprising the
watershed of Stroud Municipal Lake, whether located on property leased by the
city to cabin owners or otherwise, shall be located at least one hundred fifty
feet (150') from the high water mark on such lake. In the event that a tract of
land that has been leased by the city for cabin and recreational purposes is
not of sufficient size to place such privy one hundred fifty feet (150') from
the high water mark of such lake, then the same shall be placed upon the rear
of such tract as far distant from such high water mark as possible. All cabin
owners shall erect privies on their premises.
   B.   All such privies shall be pit tight privies, and the pit shall be of
concrete with six inch (6") walls. The bottom of such pit shall be three feet
(3') square and five feet (5') in depth. Such pit shall be covered by a
reinforced concrete slab four inches (4") thick and four feet (4') square, with
an appropriate riser for a seat. The seat shall be covered with a flytight lid
and shall remain closed when not in use. Such pit shall be constructed so as to
be flytight and the joints between the slab and the pit walls shall be kept
covered with cement or dirt at all times. All privy pits shall be cleaned out
when the same become filled to a point within eighteen inches (18") of the top
of the pit.
   C.   Septic tanks may be constructed upon such premises, but the same shall
be constructed to conform to and meet all requirements set forth in the state
department of health, form no. 600, a copy of which is on file with the city
clerk. Such septic tanks and tile fields shall be located the same distance
from the high water mark as outdoor privies, as required in this section. (2000
Code § 11-306)
ARTICLE B. BOATING REGULATIONS
11-310: LICENSE TO OPERATE BOATS REQUIRED:
No person shall operate any boat in or upon any of the water of Stroud
Municipal Lake, or any tributary or arm thereof, without first obtaining a
license from the city therefor, and then only in conformity with the provisions
of this chapter. (2000 Code § 11-310)
11-311: FEES:
Any person may obtain a license for the use of a rowboat, sailboat or motorboat
upon Stroud Municipal Lake, upon application to the city clerk or such other
person as may be designated by the city council to issue the same, and upon the
payment of the sum as set by the council by motion or resolution for an annual
license or for a daily license fee. The council may also provide that residents
over sixty five (65) years of age have separate fee requirements. (2000 Code §
11-311)
11-312: ISSUANCE, TERMS AND CONDITIONS:
   A.   All licenses issued pursuant to this article shall bear the date of
issuance and the date of expiration. All annual licenses shall expire on
December 31 of each calendar year, and all daily licenses shall expire at
twelve o'clock (12:00) midnight on the date of issuance.
   B.   All licenses shall be issued on forms provided by the city clerk and
approved by the city council and shall be nontransferable.
   C.   Each person holding a license for boating upon Stroud Municipal Lake
shall have his license therefor in his immediate possession when so boating,
and shall produce the same for inspection upon demand of any officer,
custodian, patrolman or representative of the city. (2000 Code § 11-312)
11-313: NUMBERING OF BOATS; RENEWAL:
   A.   All boats for which a license has been issued to operate on Stroud
Municipal Lake shall be numbered in the order in which the license is granted,
with numbers beginning at "one" and running numerically for the full number of
boats for which licenses have been issued, and each boat shall be inspected by
the lake patrolman, who shall designate the number of persons allowed in the
boat.
   B.   Any person owning an annual boat license for any calendar year, who
obtains a new annual license for the ensuing year on or before January 10 of
any calendar year, may retain the same number on his boat as of the previous
year, but unless such new annual license is obtained on or before January 10,
such number shall be forfeited and a new number obtained. (2000 Code § 11-313)
11-314: REVOCATION:
   A.   All licenses issued pursuant to this article shall be conditioned upon
the strict observance by the holders and users thereof of the terms of this
chapter and any other ordinances, rules or regulations promulgated by the city
council for the protection of Stroud Municipal Lake from pollution or
contamination, all state sanitary laws and all state and federal game and fish
laws, while upon such water or the premises occupied thereby.
   B.   A violation of such condition shall constitute a violation of this
chapter and the city council, upon conviction of any such holder or user of
such license of such violation, in addition to other penalties for violation of
this chapter, may revoke and cancel the license of such holder, and such
convicted holder or user shall not be eligible for another license until the
city council shall so order. (2000 Code § 11-314)
11-315: RESTRICTIONS ON OPERATION AND USE OF BOATS GENERALLY:
   A.   No boat shall be operated or permitted to be used upon the Stroud
Municipal Lake unless such boat is equipped with and contains at least one U.S.
coast guard approved life preserver for each person in such boat. Such life
preserver shall be a standard make and shall be inspected by the caretaker of
such lake. All boats used upon such lake shall likewise be inspected by the
caretaker and no boat or life preserver may be used upon such waters unless the
same is inspected and approved by the caretaker or some other person designated
by the city council to make such inspection.
   B.   No person under the age of sixteen (16) years shall row, sail or
operate any boat upon such lake.
   C.   All boats when not in use shall be fastened securely to the shore by
lock and chain.
   D.   No person operating any boat upon such lake shall throw into or permit
to enter such water any unused bait, worms, flesh of animals or other matter
subject to putrefaction, or any human or animal excreta or other debris or any
other unsanitary or unsightly thing.
   E.   No boat propelled by motor on Stroud Municipal Lake shall pass, with
the motor in operation, nearer than one hundred feet (100') to where any person
is fishing, nor shall such motorboats be operated in any part of such lake that
may be set apart and reserved therefrom from time to time by order of the city
council. Such restricted areas shall be designated by notices posted thereon,
or adjacent thereto. (2000 Code § 11-315)
11-316: TYPES AND SIZES OF BOATS PERMITTED:
   A.   No boat shall be operated or permitted to be used upon Stroud Municipal
Lake in excess of eight feet (8') wide and thirty feet (30') in length, nor
under forty inches (40") wide and twelve feet (12') in length, and no license
shall be issued for any boat in excess or under such dimensions. All metal
boats shall contain at least two (2) air chambers of sufficient size to float
such boat and such air chambers shall be kept in repair so that the same shall
not leak, and no metal boat shall be permitted upon such lake equipped with
good and sufficient air chambers as above provided.
   B.   No houseboat shall be operated or permitted to be used upon such lake
and no license shall be issued for the same, and no boat of any kind or
character shall be operated or permitted upon such lake if such boat is
equipped with bunks, beds or other living quarters. No persons shall be
permitted to sleep, live or cook in any boat operated upon the waters of such
lake. (2000 Code § 11-316)
11-317: SPEED LIMIT FOR BOATS:
Except as otherwise provided in this chapter, no boat shall be propelled upon
the waters of Stroud Municipal Lake at a greater speed than forty (40) miles
per hour. (2000 Code § 11-317)
11-318: JET SKIS; LICENSE, FEES:
Jet skis may be licensed to operate on the Stroud Municipal Lake; provided,
that they are licensed, pay fees, and are subject to the same rules and
restrictions with regard to the operating of boats as provided in this article.
(2000 Code § 11-318)
ARTICLE C. FISHING REGULATIONS
11-320: FISHING LICENSE REQUIRED; EXCEPTIONS:
No person shall fish in any of the waters of Stroud Municipal Lake, or in or
upon any tributary or arm of such lake, without first obtaining a license from
the state therefor, and then only in conformity with the provisions of this
chapter. (2000 Code § 11-320)
11-321: RESTRICTIONS UPON KIND AND AMOUNT OF FISH TAKEN:
   A.   No person shall take from the waters of Stroud Municipal Lake any of
the following:
      1.   Largemouth or smallmouth bass under fourteen inches (14") in length;
      2.   Blue cat under ten inches (10") in length; or
      3.   Warmouth, rock bass, yellow or ring perch, bluegill or bream under
six inches (6") in length.
   B.   All of the fish listed in subsection A of this section are hereby
declared to be game fish within the purview of this article, and no persons
fishing under one license shall catch or retain more than fifteen (15) such
fish in one day. Under no circumstances shall a maximum number of game fish
include more than five (5) bass and such maximum catch shall not exceed in any
one day ten (10) pounds and one fish, including game fish and nongame fish.
   C.   No person having a license to fish in Stroud Municipal Lake shall at
any time or in any manner take from the waters of such lake any flathead
catfish. The taking of such catfish at any time or in any manner is prohibited.
   D.   Any person violating this section, upon conviction thereof, shall
forfeit his license to fish in such lake. (2000 Code § 11-321)
11-322: NETS, SEINES RESTRICTED:
No person shall fish in Stroud Municipal Lake, except with a hook and line with
plugs, artificial bait, minnows, flies or similar devices. No trotline, seine,
minnow seine, gun, trap or any kind of snare shall be used to take fish from
such waters. No person shall take or attempt to take fish from such waters by
means of a net, trotline, seine, trap, gun or any explosive, poison, chemical
or other substance placed therein. (2000 Code § 11-322)
11-323: RESTRICTIONS ON USE OF CERTAIN BAIT:
No "game fish", as defined by the laws of the state or this chapter, and no
carp or buffalo, shall be used as bait to fish in Stroud Municipal Lake, and no
person shall turn loose any minnows or other bait fish in such waters. No
person shall keep, place or maintain in such waters any live box or other
receptacle for keeping minnows or other fish alive, except while actually
fishing. (2000 Code § 11-323)
ARTICLE D. HUNTING REGULATIONS
11-340: HUNTING LICENSE REQUIRED:
No person shall hunt or shoot upon any waters of Stroud Municipal Lake, or in
any tributary or arm thereof, or on the lands owned and controlled by the city
surrounding such waters, without first obtaining a license from the city
therefor, and then only in conformity with the provisions of this article.
(2000 Code § 11-340)
11-341: PERMANENT LICENSES FOR RESIDENTS SIXTY FIVE YEARS OF AGE OR OVER:
   A.   Except as provided in this section, all bona fide residents of the
state who have attained the age of sixty five (65) years shall not be required
to purchase a license under this article from the city to hunt in Stroud
Municipal Lake.
   B.   Any such person shall make application to the city clerk for a
permanent license to hunt in such lake, and upon furnishing to the city clerk
written evidence of the fact that he is over sixty five (65) years of age, he
shall be granted a permanent license to hunt in such lake. (2000 Code § 11-341)
11-342: FEES:
   A.   Any bona fide resident of the county may obtain a license to hunt upon
such waters and the land surrounding the same upon the payment of an annual
license fee as set by the council by motion or resolution.
   B.   Any bona fide resident of the state may obtain a license to hunt upon
the waters or the land owned and controlled by the city surrounding such lake
upon payment of an annual license fee or daily license fee as set by the
council by motion or resolution. No person shall go upon such lake or upon the
land owned by the city surrounding the same for the purpose of hunting without
first having obtained a permit to hunt.
   C.   The issuance of the hunting licenses above enumerated shall entitle the
holder thereof to hunt at such times and in such parts of the lake as may be
designated by the order of the city council from time to time; and provided,
that such applicant shall possess at that time a state hunting license.
   D.   Any person having a state hunting license issued by the state game
department may obtain a permit to hunt ducks, geese or other migratory fowls
upon Stroud Municipal Lake and the land surrounding the same, upon payment of a
fee for a season's license or for any period less than the season as set by the
council by motion or resolution. All of the above permits to be issued by the
city clerk or by the lake patrol officer upon payment of the fee above
described. (2000 Code § 11-342)
11-343: ISSUANCE; TERMS AND CONDITIONS:
   A.   All licenses issued pursuant to this article shall bear the date of
issuance and the date of expiration. All annual licenses shall expire on
December 31 of each calendar year, and all daily licenses shall expire at
twelve o'clock (12:00) midnight on the date of issuance.
   B.   All licenses shall be issued on forms provided by the city clerk and
approved by the city council and shall be nontransferable.
   C.   Each person holding a license for hunting upon Stroud Municipal Lake
shall have his license therefor in his immediate possession when so hunting,
and shall produce the same for inspection upon demand of any officer,
custodian, patrol officer or representative of the city.
   D.   The city council, by motion or resolution, may direct the nonissuance
of hunting licenses for such periods and at such times at it determines to be
in the best interest of the city. (2000 Code § 11-343)
11-344: EXPIRATION OF DAILY LICENSES:
A daily hunting license issued pursuant to this article shall be good for a
period of twenty four (24) hours from the time of the issuance of such license.
(2000 Code § 11-344)
11-345: REVOCATION:
   A.   All licenses issued pursuant to this article shall be conditioned upon
the strict observance by the holders and users thereof of the terms of this
article and any other ordinances, rules or regulations promulgated by the city
council for the protection of Stroud Municipal Lake from pollution or
contamination, all state sanitary laws and all state and federal game and fish
laws, while upon such waters or the premises occupied thereby.
   B.   A violation of any such condition shall constitute a violation of the
terms of this article, and the city council, upon conviction of any such holder
or user of such license of such violation, in addition to other penalties for
violation of this article, may revoke and cancel the license of such holder,
and such convicted holder or user shall not be eligible for another license
until the city council shall so order. (2000 Code § 11-345)
11-346: AUTHORITY GRANTED UNDER HUNTING LICENSES GENERALLY:
The issuance of a hunting license pursuant to this article shall entitle the
holder thereof to hunt at such times and in such parts of Stroud Municipal
Lake, and the land owned or controlled by the city surrounding such lakes, as
may be designated from time to time by the city council; provided, that such
person shall possess at such time a state hunting license. (2000 Code § 11-346)
11-347: PROHIBITIONS AND RESTRICTIONS ON HUNTING GENERALLY:
   A.   The holder of a hunting license under this article shall have the
privilege of hunting for and shooting upon Stroud Municipal Lake, and the land
surrounding the same, any duck, geese and other waterfowl in such places and at
such times as the city council shall from time to time direct. Such areas of
such waters or the lands surrounding the same as may at any time be restricted
against hunting or shooting thereon shall be designated by signs thereon or
adjacent thereto.
   B.   Except as otherwise provided in this article, no holder of a hunting
license or any other person shall at any time hunt or shoot any game of any
kind upon such waters, or the land surrounding the same, except duck, geese or
other waterfowl, and no holder of a hunting license or any other person shall
use, shoot or discharge upon such waters or the lands surrounding the same any
firearm other than a shotgun and shot used with or fired from such shotgun
shall not be a size larger than number 2. (2000 Code § 11-347)
ARTICLE E. OTHER REGULATIONS
11-350: CAMPING FEES AND REQUIREMENTS:
The city council, by motion or resolution, may set fees and regulations
governing daily and overnight camping around Stroud Municipal Lake and its
grounds. (2000 Code § 11-350)
11-351: ANIMALS:
   A.   No person shall bring or allow dogs, cats or other pets or animals into
any area of Stroud Lake unless penned, caged, on a leash under six feet (6') in
length or otherwise physically restrained.
   B.   All animals and pets are prohibited in swimming areas of Stroud Lake.
   C.   Persons bringing or allowing pets in designated public areas shall be
responsible for proper removal and disposal in sanitary facilities of any waste
produced by these animals.
   D.   Ranging, grazing, watering or allowing livestock on Stroud Municipal
Lake lands and waters is prohibited, except where authorized in writing by the
City Manager or his designee.
   E.   Unclaimed or unattended animals are subject to immediate impoundment
and removal in accordance with City ordinances and an impoundment fee levied.
This fee shall be paid before the impounded animal is returned to its owner.
(2000 Code § 11-351)
11-352: ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES AND BEER:
No person shall overtly and publicly consume or display the presence of any
beer or intoxicating liquor in any area of Stroud Municipal Lake, except within
the confines of a camping or picnic area. (2000 Code § 11-352)
11-353: FIREARMS, WEAPONS AND EXPLOSIVES PROHIBITED; EXCEPTIONS:
   A.   The possession of loaded firearms, ammunition, loaded or projectable
firing devices, bows and arrows, crossbows, explosion or explosive devices of
any kind, including fireworks, is prohibited at Stroud Municipal Lake, except
in accordance with 21 Oklahoma Statutes 2011 section 1272, et seq., as amended.
(Ord. 276, 12-13-2012)
   B.   Possession of loaded firearms, ammunition, loaded projectile firing
devices of any kind, including fireworks, is permitted at Stroud Municipal Lake
when:
      1.   Any of the above is in the possession of Federal, State or local law
enforcement officers;
      2.   Any of the above are being used for hunting as permitted with
devices being unloaded when transported to, from or between hunting sites;
      3.   Any of the above being used at authorized shooting ranges;
      4.   Written permission from the City Manager or his designee for use of
any of the above; and (2000 Code § 11-353)
      5.   Provisions of 21 Oklahoma Statutes 2011 section 1272, et seq., as
amended effective November 1, 2012 are complied with by the person in
possession of said firearm. (Ord. 276, 12-13-2012)
11-354: UNATTENDED PERSONAL PROPERTY:
   A.   Personal property of any kind shall not be left unattended, stored or
abandoned upon lands and waters of Stroud Municipal Lake. After a period of
twenty four (24) hours, or at any time after posted closure hour in a public
use area, unattended personal property shall be presumed to be abandoned and
may be impounded and stored with a reasonable impoundment fee assessed. Such
fee shall be paid before the impounded property is returned to its owner.
   B.   Personal property placed on public lands or waters adjacent to a
private residence or developments of any private nature for more than twenty
four (24) hours without written permission of the City Manager or his designee
shall be presumed to have been abandoned and acted upon accordingly. (2000 Code
§ 11-354)
11-355: CLOSING:
The City Manager or his designee may close or restrict the use of Stroud
Municipal Lake, or any portion thereof, when necessitated by reason of public
health, public safety, maintenance or other reason in the public interest for a
period not to exceed thirty (30) days. (2000 Code § 11-355)
ARTICLE F. PENALTIES FOR VIOLATION
11-360: PENALTY:
Each and every violation of any of the provisions contained in this chapter is
an offense against the City and, upon conviction of such an offense, the
violator will be punished as provided in section
1-108 of this Code. (2000 Code § 11-360)
CHAPTER 4
LIBRARY
SECTION:
11-401: Library Department And Board
11-402: Officers
11-403: Duties
11-401: LIBRARY DEPARTMENT AND BOARD:
There shall be a library department, which shall be under the supervision and
control of a library board of at least five (5) but not more than nine (9)
directors, chosen by the city council from the citizens of the city. Directors
appointed to the library board shall hold office for a term of three (3) years
from May 1 following their appointment and their terms shall be staggered. The
city council may remove any director for misconduct or neglect of duty.
Vacancies in the library board shall be filled in the same manner as original
appointments. The city council shall designate the date of termination of each
of such directors and each term will end on May 1 of that year. The members
shall serve without compensation. (2000 Code §
11-401)
11-402: OFFICERS:
Every year at the first meeting of the board after May 1, the board of
directors shall elect a chairperson and vice chairperson from its own
membership, and a secretary who need not be a member of the board. The board
shall determine the time and place of its regular meetings and the city
manager, the chairperson or any three (3) members of the board of directors may
call special meetings of the board. (2000 Code §
11-402)
11-403: DUTIES:
The board shall supervise and control the public library of the city. It may
recommend the appointment or removal of the librarian, but the actual
appointment or removal of the librarian will be made by the city council,
either directly or through its city manager. The board may recommend for
appointment or removal temporary, part time or full time employees, but such
appointment or removal shall be made by the city council acting directly or
through its city manager. The board shall adopt and may change regulations for
the administration and operation of the library and may impose fines or
suitable penalties for loss of or failure to timely return or damage of library
books and materials. The librarian, subject to the authority of the library
board of directors, shall have the supervision and control of the library,
including all personnel thereof. (2000 Code §
11-403)
CHAPTER 5
PENALTY
SECTION:
11-501: Penalty
11-501: PENALTY:
Any person, firm or corporation who shall violate any provision of this title
by doing any act prohibited or declared to be unlawful thereby, or declared to
be an offense or misdemeanor thereby, or who shall fail to do any act required
by any such provision, or who shall fail to do any act when such provision
declares such failure to be unlawful or to be an offense or misdemeanor, shall
be guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction thereof, shall be punished as
provided in section
1-108 of this code. Each day upon which any such violation continues shall
constitute a separate offense. (2000 Code §
11-501)
TITLE 12
PLANNING, ZONING AND DEVELOPMENT
CHAPTER 1
BOARDS AND COMMISSIONS
SECTION:
12-101: Planning Commission Created
12-101: PLANNING COMMISSION CREATED:
There is hereby created a planning commission of the city. The commission shall
be composed of five (5) appointive members, all of whom shall be residents of
the city, nominated by the mayor and appointed by the city council and the
mayor and city manager, who shall be ex officio members of the commission. Each
appointed member shall hold office for a term of two (2) years. The appointed
members of the commission shall be nominated and appointed solely with
reference to their fitness and without reference to party affiliation, and
shall serve without compensation. Members may be removed by the mayor with
approval of the city council only for the good of the service. Vacancies
occurring otherwise than through the expiration of term shall be filled only
for the unexpired term. Ex officio members shall receive no compensation for
their work on the planning commission. The planning commission shall have such
powers and duties and organization as provided by ordinance and law. (2000 Code
§
12-101)
CHAPTER 2
ZONING REGULATIONS
SECTION:
12-201: Zoning Ordinance Adopted
12-201: ZONING ORDINANCE ADOPTED:
   A.   An amended zoning ordinance is hereby adopted for the city, which
establishes zoning districts for the properties within the incorporated limits
of the city, and establishes an official zoning map; prescribes limitations on
land use; prescribes the different types of uses permitted in the different
districts established, including agricultural districts, residential districts,
commercial districts, industrial districts and floodplain districts;
prescribing uses to which lands within districts can be utilized; setting forth
requirements, standards and designs for off street parking; containing
regulations on nonconforming structures and uses; providing for the enforcement
of this ordinance; requiring application for zoning clearing permit and setting
forth the fees to be paid for obtaining such permits; establishing a board of
adjustment and prescribing the powers and proceedings before the board;
prescribing the method of making zoning amendments; and defining certain terms
used in such amended zoning ordinance.
   B.   Subsection A of this section contains a condensed gist or summary of
the contents of the city of Stroud amended zoning ordinance, ordinance 105. At
least three (3) copies of such ordinance are on file in the office of the city
clerk at city hall, and are available for public use, inspection and
examination. (2000 Code §
12-201)
